result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Francis Murphy

defendant.name: Murphy, Michael Francis
defendant.address: N2095 S West Rd, Ogema, WI 54459

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Order Denying Motion to Modify Bond /s/ MDZ 10/27/22
Motion hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Exhibit #P1 Copy of Criminal Complaint

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:08 PM Defendant Michael Francis Murphy appeared by video, in custody Taylor County.   Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Michael Francis Murphy.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear by Zoom and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant is able to see and hear all parties clearly.
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
If at any time the defendant needs to speak privately with his attorney, the court will make accommodations for that.
Defendant indicates he understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his attorney.
BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily consenting to use of telephonic conferencing. 
ADA Jambois calls witness, Deputy Holdman, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
Witness identifies the defendant on the screen.
Exhibit P#1 is marked and referred to during direct exam.
ADA Jambois moves to admit Exhibit P#1. No objections.
BY THE COURT: Exhibit P#1 is received.
Cross exam by Atty Soule.
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

4:21 PM Defendant Michael Francis Murphy appeared by video, in custody from Milwaukee Secure Detention .  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Michael Francis Murphy.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Matter is rescheduled.
Bond is continued.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bond filed by Atty Taylor Soule (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 09/16/22 sp)

1:34 PM Defendant Michael Francis Murphy appeared by video, in custody at Milwaukee Secure Detention.   Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Michael Francis Murphy.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Written Waiver of Preliminary Hearing had been filed by Atty Soule on August 29, 2022 and her client is willing to waive his preliminary hearing at this time.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
1:43 p.m.  Defendant interrupts and indicates to the Court that the has just received some new information and now wishes to have his preliminary hearing held. 
Preliminary Hearing to be held within time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Waiver of Preliminary Examination filed by Atty Taylor Soule

2:42 PM Defendant Michael Francis Murphy not in court.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Michael Francis Murphy. 

ADA Dodge states that the defendant was transferred to Milwaukee Secure Detention.
Atty Soule has no objection to the adjournment and makes additional statements.

BY THE COURT: 
Case is adjourned.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
filed by Atty Taylor Soule
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Taylor Soule
Initial Appearance set for August 15, 2022 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 1
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

1:18 PM Defendant Michael Francis Murphy III appeared by video in custody. 
Assistant  District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner is present in the courtroom.
ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine and Bail Jumping. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender and is eligible.
State requests a bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner  does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
